name: Hampton Inn Savannah - Historic District

reviews.text: I want tk say the staff was great and tried to make our stay ok. We used Hilton points at upgraded rates for this special trip. It was impossible to close the drapes so lighf was kept out. They changed ouf room to the second floor which was close to street noises. Not a good situation. They offered another roon but not what wd had reserved.
reviews.title: Location great but street noise kept us awake

reviews.text: Positives: Staff was great; valet service great; breakfast ok and location perfect.
reviews.title: Clean rooms, nice location

reviews.text: GM has offered to refund my points for one night but no result yet
reviews.title: Overall nice

reviews.text: Stayed here with my husband and another couple. We booked months in advance and booked 2 rooms together. You would think we'd have gotten rooms next to each other or at least on the same floor. However, this was not the case and was a huge bummer. That aside, the rooms were clean and decently priced, the breakfast was pretty good (hot and cold items) and the hot items changed daily, and the location was excellent. We were able to just walk across the street to River Street and it just so happened it was Tall Ships weekend so that was a bonus. All in all a very nice stay!
reviews.title: Excellent service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean but very small for the price. When paying over two hundred plus parking I expect a little larger room. The staff was nice, the breakfast was maybe a little better than average.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is situated in very impressive premises, the lobby is beautifully furnished and the rooms are well furnished with comfortable beds. In all other aspects it is a typical HI product and I do not understand the star rating system but suspect it is the lack of restaurant that prevents the property from having a higher rating. The River St is a few minutes walk and the free shuttle stop just a couple of hundred yards away ....
reviews.title: Good, but could have been excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But:
reviews.title: Wonderful stay but too short!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast area is very limited and there were guests having to stand to eat.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Rooms!
Great hotel, great location
reviews.text: The bed linen could have been larger and some of the towels were a bit grey.

When we found that our room had not been made up by 3.45 on one day we were told that it was our fault for leaving the 'do not disturb' sign outside before we went out at 10.30. Notwithstanding the fact that the trolley was standing unattended outside the room.Certain reception staff need to understand that it is better not to try to make excuses.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I called to reserve two nights. Was told the rate was $145/night. They emailed a confirmation which said first night $145, second night $198. I called and they said it had changed, now first night $165, second night $198. I said I'd like them to honor the price they originally quoted. They said it now changed: $198/night. Then changed back to $145 first night, $198 second. I cancelled second night. The hotel is very nice but our TV volume control didn't work. It was on full volume, which was deafening. So we couldn't use it or the whole place would be awake. Room was clean, location good, breakfast excellent (for an extra $12). But because of the desk staff we would never stay there again.
reviews.title: Desk staff hopeless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed 6 nights here it is very central and the rooms re large and beds comfortable. House keeping do a great job as the hotel is spotless clean. the breakfast was ok the breakfast staff on duty seemed to be quite surly. we had some noise from the street but not enough to keep you awake. the pool is small but nice. There are some nice places to eat very close by B Mathews is down the block and Vics is across the street both really good also Molly mc phearsons in the city Market are is good food and music avoid the kevin barry pub on river street food is awful music is ok but terrible atmosphere. The savannah bus tour companny was great and if thus is your first visit to Savannah red the book in the garden of good and evil. This is an amzing city with great people.
reviews.title: excellent
Must stay
reviews.text: This is a great hotel. I stayed here for two nights.. I had read reviews but didn't book prior as I wanted to see the location first.. I was lucky to be able to get a room for 2 nights.. Don't risk it just book! Rooms are large and clean. Fantastic location.. I drove my car in and it has remained in parking since! Yes wi fi isn't great in room.. But it's free... The breakfast I didn't have a problem with.. A lot of choices... And again.. It's free.. Traveling alone I felt very safe and secure in this area.. I haven't seen another place (and I have done a lot of walking around) that I would rather have stayed at..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had the pleasure of meeting Mary Hurn, Concierge at the Hampton Inn Savannah - Historic District. Ms. Hurn provided valuable information regarding attractions and the area in general to a couple who knew very little about the Historic District when we arrived. Thanks to this professional staffer our time spent in Savannah was greatly enhanced.
reviews.title: Helpful Concierge
Great Hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a night here. The location was great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Hampton inn this past week and found it to be delightful and fabulous. To start the location is spot on. You are close to so many things and there is a stop on the old savannah tours there. The staff is very courteous and goes above and beyond. I do have to mention Michelle and latikisha they were extra special and helpful. They knew restaurants to go to and just went above and beyond. The room had a great view of the river,which I really miss. The room was also a floor below the pool. The pool was small but amazing view of the river and the city. At night it was great to lounge and look at the sunset. In the morning after breakfast it was also good to relax there before heading out. It was an amazing trip because the people at this hotel made you feel like family. I was really sad to go but I will definitely be back soon :)
reviews.title: Love savannah :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent four nights here during he Tall Ships weekend and everything was excellent. We have traveled extensively at Hampton Inns and this hotel rates with the best of them. The location is ideal for anyone visiting Savannah and wanting to be along the riverfront. The hotel has seven floors, half of them overlooking River Street and the river. We were fortunate to get a room on the 7th. floor (top floor) overlooking the river where we could watch the ships entering and leaving port. The pool is on the rooftop and an excellent place to see the river and take photographs.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room with a king-size bed was an adequate size for the two of us. Our room included a microwave, mini-refrigrator and coffee maker. Our wireless internet connection was OK but slow at times during the evening.
reviews.title: Top-notch Hampton Inn in Ideal Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is directly under the hotel and valet-only because of tight parking spaces. The parking charge was $15 per day. A less expensive indoor parking lot is acrosss the street, but has no in-and-out privileges. An elevator in the entrance area gave us access to the parking levels and our car so we didn't have to move everything to our room at check-in.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was the standard Hampton Inn buffet, with two waffle irons. Several attendants did a good job keeping everything replenished and clean.
reviews.title: I love Savannah

aka: Hampton Inn Savannah - Historic District Hotel
description: The Hampton Inn Savannah Historic District hotel is located in downtown Savannah on Bay Street with easy access to River Street. Walk to local attractions like River Street, Savannah International Trade & Convention Center, and City Market. Enjoy a swim in our rooftop outdoor pool with views of historic Savannah. Relax with our free hot breakfast every morning. Get some work done with our free high-speed internet access and business center.
